intro: Adenocalymma racemosum, commonly known as the clustered rock-heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its compact growth habit. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in racemes, which are clusters of flowers along a stem. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Adenocalymma racemosum is adapted to withstand drought and high salinity, making it a hardy species in its native habitat.
